a11rallypong

Class ball

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • a11rallypong.base
        • a11rallypong.ball
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class ball
extends base
    The ball class creates a ball that moves around on the screen and is hit back and forth between two paddles. It extends the base class just like the paddle.
    Author:
    Erich

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void bounceOnX()
      The bounceOnX method is called whenever the ball hits a paddle.
      void bounceOnY()
      The bounceOnY method is called whenever the ball comes in contact with the top or bottom of the screen, it simply inverts the balls y velocity.
      void despawn()
      The despawn method sets the despawned boolean to true when called.
      void getVels()
      getVels sets the dx and dy of the ball when it is instantiated by calling their assigned methods.
      void Paint(java.awt.Graphics g)
      The Paint method draws the ball on the frame.
      void preventReverb() 
      void randomDx()
      The randomDx method gets a random dx of either 2 or -2 to launch the ball, this way it is random as to which side the ball is served to.
      double randomDy()
      The randomDy method returns a value to be assigned to the balls y velocity.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ball

        public ball(int x,
            int y,
            int screenH,
            int screenW)
        The base constructor takes in four values to setup the items on the screen in their designated spots.
        Parameters:
        x - the desired initial position of the object on the x axis.
        y - the desired initial position of the object on the y axis.
        screenH - the height of the screen the object is being displayed on.
        screenW - the width of the screen the object is being displayed on.

    • Method Detail

      • Paint

        public void Paint(java.awt.Graphics g)
        The Paint method draws the ball on the frame.
        Specified by:
        Paint in class base
        Parameters:
        g - Graphics employed by the frame the object is being drawn on.

      • bounceOnX

        public void bounceOnX()
        The bounceOnX method is called whenever the ball hits a paddle. It first determines how fast the ball is going and then decides if it should increment it by 10% or just leave it at its defined speed limit. After determining the multiplier it multiplys the balls dx by this multiplier and increments hitcount. Finally the preventReverb method is called.
        Specified by:
        bounceOnX in class base

      • bounceOnY

        public void bounceOnY()
        The bounceOnY method is called whenever the ball comes in contact with the top or bottom of the screen, it simply inverts the balls y velocity.
        Specified by:
        bounceOnY in class base

      • preventReverb

        public void preventReverb()

      • despawn

        public void despawn()
        The despawn method sets the despawned boolean to true when called.
        Specified by:
        despawn in class base

      • randomDx

        public void randomDx()
        The randomDx method gets a random dx of either 2 or -2 to launch the ball, this way it is random as to which side the ball is served to.

      • randomDy

        public double randomDy()
        The randomDy method returns a value to be assigned to the balls y velocity. It ranges from 1 to -1 in decimals.
        Returns:
        a double to be assigned to dy.

      • getVels

        public void getVels()
        getVels sets the dx and dy of the ball when it is instantiated by calling their assigned methods.
